message:
That makes sense. Implemented as per above, changing the InitializeAsync call to a Window loaded event instead of in the ctor.

Now though the UI binding isn't showing the returned data on the View.

1. Stepped through code, it shows that the list is being returned to the VM in CustomerOrder list, but the UI doesn't reflect that.)

2.Checked the data binding with test data, UI binding and data context is set up correctly.

Any idea why that's happened after adding the AwaitableMessages implementation?

This is a gist of the current VM and View:

[https://gist.github.com/BrianJVarley/b1daebc217b138ac6beb](https://gist.github.com/BrianJVarley/b1daebc217b138ac6beb)
